enWisdom: Acquisitions are deprivation [from peace of mind]

Wisdom: النَّاسُ رَجُلَانِ طَالِبٌ لَا يَجِدُ وَوَاجِدٌ لَا يَكْتَفِي
enWisdom: People are of two types: the seeker who does not find [what he is looking for] and the finder who is not satisfied [with what he has found]

Wisdom: اسْتَعِيذُوا بِاللَّهِ مِنْ سَكْرَةِ الْغِنَى فَإِنَّ لَهُ سَكْرَةً بَعِيدَةَ الْإِفَاقَةِ
enWisdom: Seek refuge with Allah from the intoxication of riches, for indeed it has an intoxication that takes long to recover from
He (‘a) said about the one whom he censured: If he becomes wealthy, he turns arrogant and falls into vice
The bane of affluence is stinginess
Many a person who gains is [actually] a loser

Wisdom: رُبَّ رَبَاحٍ يَئُولُ [أَرْبَاحٍ تَئُولُ‏] إِلَى خُسْرَانٍ
enWisdom: Many a profit turns back into loss
Sometimes a rich person may be needier than a poor person
Increase in [one’s desire for] this world corrupts the Hereafter

Wisdom: عَجِبْتُ لِلشَّقِيِّ الْبَخِيلِ يَتَعَجَّلُ الْفَقْرَ الَّذِي مِنْهُ هَرَبَ وَيَفُوتُهُ الْغِنَى الَّذِي إِيَّاهُ طَلَبَ فَيَعِيشُ فِي الدُّنْيَا عَيْشَ الْفُقَرَاءِ وَيُحَاسَبُ فِي الْآخِرَةِ حِسَابَ الْأَغْنِيَاءِ
enWisdom: I am amazed at the wretched miser who rushes towards the poverty that is fleeing him and loses the wealth that is seeking him; he lives a life of poverty in this world and is called to account with the reckoning of the wealthy in the Hereafter
The deception of wealth leads to insolence

Wisdom: قَلِيلٌ مِنَ الْأَغْنِيَاءِ مَنْ يُوَاسِي وَيُسْعِفُ
enWisdom: Few are the rich who [financially] support and assist others

Wisdom: لَمْ يَضَعِ امْرُؤٌ مَالَهُ فِي غَيْرِ حَقِّهِ أَوْ مَعْرُوفَهُ فِي غَيْرِ أَهْلِهِ إِلَّا حَرَمَهُ اللَّهُ شُكْرَهُمْ وَكَانَ لِغَيْرِهِ وُدُّهُمْ
enWisdom: A person does not give his wealth to the one who has no right to it, or his favour to one who is not deserving of it, but that Allah deprives him of their gratefulness and their love, too, would be for others
